attributes.action: Repeal ALL anti-smoking legislation.
attributes.background: Smoking tobacco is a legal past time, the Government has no legitimate right to restrict a legal activity.  The covering up of cigarettes in shops is ridiculous and counter productive.  Plain packaging does not work.  The high taxation is counter productive and encourages smuggling.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for schools to teach basic BSL.
attributes.background: Communication  in children is very important. But what happens when the only way to communicate is by sign? Not being able to communicate and make friends can lower a child's self-esteem.Make it mandatory for schools to teach basic BSL in schools.

attributes.action: Make political education a compulsory lesson in schools
attributes.background: I am an 18 year old who has been shocked with the political results in 2016. Many have complained that recent referendum and election results are due to uneducated voters. Politics affects everyone, so why is it that not everyone understands or it taught about it?
attributes.additional_details: Not once in my education have I ever had a politics lesson. Even though I didn't choose to study this subject at a level, I am interested in it and feel it is vital that every student has a basic understanding of it. By scheduling compulsory political lessons for everyone you are telling young people that it matters and that their vote matters. Lack of education leads people to make uninformed choices that can have a huge effect on the end result. Let's end uneducated votes.

attributes.action: Make the time of paternity leave longer than 2 weeks
attributes.background: 2 weeks is not enough time for a father to bond with their child. In those first weeks skin to skin is so important to establish a bond between parent and child. It also is good to have helping hands after a mother has given birth (including after major surgery).
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.economist.com/blogs/economist-explains/2015/05/economist-explains-18

http://national.deseretnews.com/article/2143/10-reasons-dads-should-take-paternity-leave.html

attributes.action: Abolish University Tuition Fees
attributes.background: In 2012 the Coalition Government raised tuition fees to Â£9000 a year, which means students now face crippling debt. This shackling debt often lasts decades. Free education is a right not a privilege. We have to act now to take back what's rightfully ours!
attributes.additional_details: Young students eager to better themselves as people are facing crippling debt after they leave university unless they are born of a very wealthy family. This ensures that the wealth stays with the families who have always had it. Worse still is the number of young people denied the chance of university due to their disadvantaged background. Free education is vital if we are to have a country that utilises the most talented rather than the most fortunate. Free education is necessary for equality.

attributes.action: For the NHS to fund mTOR inhibitor and for free.
attributes.background: It will help those with TSC, will help with the facial rash that develops during the course of childhood, and will clear the rash up that is caused by TSC.
attributes.additional_details: Letters from NHS,Queen,Prime minister, and department of health.

attributes.action: PLEASE GIVE RIGHT OF APPEAL TO TIER 1 ENTREPRENEUR INITIAL & EXTENSION VISA
attributes.background: Our request to all Honourable UK Parliament members is that please restore the right of appeal for Tier 1 entrepreneur applicants if refused due to errors, Appeal right defend the applicants and allow them to provide solid evidence against the raised issues
attributes.additional_details: Applicants can apply for an administrative review of the Tier 1 entrepreneur refusal decision if they think that Home Office has made an error in considering their application.When they apply for administrative review, no evidence is allowed to forward in favour of the refused application. This means that if Home Office maintained the refused decision then they order applicants to leave the country ASAP and they could lose their running business and investment that could ruin their future

attributes.action: Licence and regulate nail technicians, hairdressers and beauticians.
attributes.background: People in the hair and beauty industry are not always qualified or have only done 1 day of training which isnt enough, these uneducated people are working on the public with no knowlage and insurance. They are also causing harm and damage to the public aswell as illegal workers being exploited.
attributes.additional_details: Not being educated in this industry, working on the public and having illness, disabilities, young children and exploitation of illegal workers could cause serious harm to people. Also the people who are working without the correct qualification IS NOT able to obtain any form of insurance meaning they are not covered incase of accident or damage.

attributes.action: Force Local Authorities to allocate a proportion of housing to pet owners.
attributes.background: People are being forced to make the decision between giving up their pets or being homeless.  For some people their pet is the only family they have, and the animal is often vital for helping with mental health issues. People end up living on the streets rather than giving up their beloved friend.
attributes.additional_details: In every town in Britain there are people living on the streets, for no other reason than their local authority is refusing to home them. They are given the impossible choice of giving up their pet or being homeless. They are vulnerable people, and are being discriminated against for sharing love and companionship with a pet. It would be detrimental for them to lose their pets, and would put additional strain on the mental health service. They are at risk of serious harm or death on the street.

attributes.action: Table a UN Security Council resolution on Daesh to end impunity for genocide
attributes.background:
HMG must take decisive steps to: 
1. table a UN SC resolution establishing a commission of experts on genocide and then establishing an ad hoc tribunal; or 
2. table a UN SC resolution referring the situation in Syria and Iraq (as caused by Daesh since 2014) to the International Criminal Court.
attributes.additional_details: Daesh is responsible for genocidal atrocities on minorities, including Christians, Yazidis, and other religious minorities, in the Middle East and beyond. This genocide was recognized by the European Parliament, the Council of Europe, and the US, Australian, and Canadian governments. In April 2016, the House of Commons called upon HMG to take the lead at the UN SC. This steps has not been taken yet and is urgently needed to end impunity and to ensure that justice is served.

attributes.action: End industrial breeding of domestic pets to protect the welfare of  animals.
attributes.background:
The Australian Government has just introduced new legislation into Parliament. Their Domestic Animals Act protects the welfare of breeding animals to ensure that their pets come from good homes.
By overhauling the Animal Welfare Act 2006, we in the UK can reform breeding and pet shop industries.
attributes.additional_details:
â¢ Reduce the number of fertile female dogs a breeder can keep.

â¢ Crack down on backyard breeders, so they will have to register with their council as a Domestic Animal Business.

â¢ Establish a Registry of these businesses, giving councils the information to determine who is eligible to register as a breeder and better police the new laws.

â¢ Pet shops will no longer be able to sell puppies and kittens unless they have come from a registered breeder, foster home, animal shelter or charity.

â¢ Foster Carers who look after pets waiting for new homes will have clearer rights and responsibilities â caring for animals without having to register as a Domestic Animal Business, but with the benefit from reduced council registration fees.

attributes.action: Implement a 12 month ban for using mobiles while driving.
attributes.background: Far too many people are still ignoring the fact that people are being injured and killed daily due to mobile phone distraction behind the wheel. If you get caught driving and using your phone you should face the same punishment as drink drivers and be banned from driving for 12 months.
attributes.additional_details:
More than 500,000 drivers still using mobile phones at wheel, study shows
At least one in 20 drivers aged under 30 have been caught flouting the law 
Report said using hand-held device is more dangerous than drink or drugs
In 2013, mobile phone use behind the wheel was factor in 22 fatal collisions


Read more: http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/

attributes.action: ban the use of prong and shock collars for dogs within the UK.
attributes.background: Prong and shock collars can cause psychological and physical harm to dogs even when correctly used and can even precipitate aggression in the animal. At present there is no legislation restricting their use and anyone can apply them to any dog.
attributes.additional_details: Many so called trainers many with few or no qualifications use them and get obedience because the dog is terrified of the pain and distress caused rather than because it has been well trained. Alternative methods are effective  see site https://positively.com/dog-training/methods-equipment/training-equipment/choke-and-prong-collars/ for details of the injuries caused by these devices

attributes.action: Recommission Britannia and give the Queen her boat back - she's earned it!
attributes.background: The Queen has been selfless in her work for this country and the Commonwealth. We took one her great loves away from her and its about time Great Britain and the Commonwealth gave her something back.
attributes.additional_details: This would also benefit Great Britain in its pursuit of international trade deals following its exit from the EU.

attributes.action: Bring back compulsory dog licences. Making it offence to own a dog without one.
attributes.background:
Unfortunately back in 1987 when policing  issues were harder this law was Abolished. 
With modern laws and regulations a new licence can be enforced. 
This will aid in the reduction of Back Yard Breeding and the ever increasing over population of stray dogs in rescue centres accross the country.
attributes.additional_details:
Most countries still have licences. 
Having one makes the owner accountable for its dogs actions. 
If your dog goes missing the chances of getting it back are greater. 
No puppy can be bought without a licence including their vaccination details. 
Greater fines for owners without a licence.
DNA records would be held for prosecution and identification purposes. 
Breeders can only sell dogs with a recognised licence and permit.
Service dogs would be free. 
Elderly concession rates.

attributes.action: Minimum 5 years in prison for possession of indecent photograph of a child
attributes.background: I think it's very shocking that people found in possession of child porn (criminal justice act 1988 section 160) get maximum of 5 years prison. This should be changed straight away and I think personally they should be locked up for life, but I know this ain't realistic for the government.
attributes.additional_details: This is to out of date and should be changed straight away as well as criminal justice act 1978 section 1

attributes.action: Make appropriate sex education for LGBT+ people mandatory in schools.
attributes.background: We, as young people, have very limited access to sex education in school...so when it comes to sex education regarding LGBT+ people, there is essentially nothing! This needs to change or more than just people's education could be negatively impacted. People's health could be at great risk!
attributes.additional_details: We had to visit specific charities and organisations to receive any information regarding LGBT+ sexual health. This is just not okay as it puts people at risk and creates a separation between peers (solely due to their sexuality/gender).

attributes.action: protect workers on universal credit by having their 'housing element' protected.
attributes.background: unfair sanctions mean part time workers lose their 'standard' allowance, (money to live on), and THEN have their wages deducted from their rent element aswell. So they have no money to pay bills/bank charges, no money to buy food but also no money to cover all their rent and face becoming homeless.
attributes.additional_details: I have been sanctioned my personal element of Â£317.82 for 63 days (for missing one appointment) which means the element to buy food and pay bills has gone, then because I work part time my wages are then deducted from my housing element ALSO. This is only going to lead to homelessness and severe hardship and debt. The person affected can not claim back bank charges from unpaid direct debits so they are in debt/arrears and face being homeless EVEN if this sanction is later overturned.

attributes.action: Urge the Norwegian Government to end the culling of wild wolves
attributes.background: Norway has announced that it plans to allow hunters to kill 47 wolves living in the wild, despite the species being listed as "critically endangered" on the 2015 Norwegian list of endangered animals. This represents the cull of up to two-thirds of the country's total wild wolf population.
attributes.additional_details:
- Rovdata recorded a wolf population of between 65-68 in winter 2015-2016.
- Nina Jensen, the head of the Norwegian branch of the WWF has called the plans "outright mass slaughter".
- Illustrative datapoint: a 2010 study by the U.S. Department of Agriculture showed that out of 1.7 million cattle deaths that year, only 2.3 percent were caused by predators (of which many are attributed to dogs and other predator species).
- The UK considers itself as a leader in animal welfare standards.

attributes.action: Bring back Dartford crossing barriers to even out traffic flow.
attributes.background: Bring back Dartford crossing barriers to limit the amount of traffic going into the tunnel or on the bridge at once. This could help to reduce accidents also.
attributes.additional_details: The fines are not being spent well enough if they have to be in place! Use this money to help improve our traffic flow!

attributes.action: Make basic paediatric first aid/cpr part of antenatal care
attributes.background: Many babies/young children could be saved if new parents were given guidance on simple cpr and first aid in relation to babies and young children. Early Years Professionals and healthcare professionals receive training, however, parents (who are with their children the majority of the time) do not.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for employees to be paid double on a Sunday
attributes.background: Many people including myself are required to work most, if not every Sunday, without any additional pay. Considering Sunday hasn't always been a legal trading day and the act was only put in place in 1994, I think it should be a legal requirement that all employees should be paid double on a Sunday.

attributes.action: Mandatory life sentence for child rape
attributes.background: A child who is raped has the rest of their life to face in ruins and turmoil due to what has happend to them. So why do we have such light sentences for it. With this crime increasing daily it should now have the sentence of life in prison to help prevent this awful act.

attributes.action: Abolish the High Income Child Benefit Tax Charge
attributes.background:
Abolish the Government's high income child benefit tax charge for an individual income exceeding Â£50,000 introduced in January 2013. 

This tax charge effects families when a individual parent income exceeds the threshold.  This tax charge means they are no longer eligible for full child benefit.
attributes.additional_details:
There are many instances where an individual parent income is the only source of income for an entire family.  

This tax charge isn't proportionate or fair when compared to a joint couple who's combined income can potentially reach Â£100,000 and not be subject to any child benefit tax charge. 

This tax charge needs to be abolished it's horrendously unfair and discriminates against many families.  A tax system should be fair across the board, this certainly isn't.

http://www.telegraph.co.uk/finance/comment/9788481/Abolish-child-benefit-and-give-families-a-tax-break.html

attributes.action: To limit fireworks to organised, licenced events before 9 at night.
attributes.background: I feel that nervous animals, the elderly and young children suffer when fireworks are set off at all hours on any day. 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10 and 1  o clock in the morning last night for example.
attributes.additional_details: One of my dogs who had had dental surgery began to bleed again due to her being stressed..repeatedly. People who have to get up early,  young children and the elderly cannot sleep. I'm a nurse who has witnessed elderly dementia patients think they're back in world war 2 because the loud bangs remind them of bombs going off. At least if fireworks were limited to set days and times we could prepare for it better. You can't give animals calming medication continually just in case.

attributes.action: Introduce a nationwide carbon tax applying to both citizens and corporations.
attributes.background: This petition is a call for politicians to take action against the threat of climate change before it is too late. We are calling for nationwide taxation on all activities and products contributing to the emission of carbon dioxide, which would set our country on the path to a sustainable future.

attributes.action: Gelatine in our food must be marked what animal it is from and in bold writing.
attributes.background: Gelatine is in our food, sweets, pharmaceutical products and many other products. If a product contains Gelatine, it must be written what animal it is from and it must be in bold writing. Food products that contain Gelatine must be clearly marked in bold writing Not suitable for vegetarians.

attributes.action: The government to help victims of domestic violence
attributes.background: social services need further training with dealing with women of domestic violence they are quick enough to take children away from women but they are not trained to support women in getting out of these relationship or helping women to be reunited with their children
attributes.additional_details: All cases involving social services and courts should have a expert witness available to explain to everyone the effects and complications of domestically violent relationships also to help everyone understand it. Too many women are just deemed as bad mothers for not being able to escape domestically abusive relationship when there is no support even from social services

attributes.action: Bring back the Death Penalty for Murder, Rape and Child Molestation
attributes.background: With the growing murder and rape pandemic, it is necessary to have a deterrent.  Too long the government and judges have trivialised murder, rape and child molestation with poor sentences. The victims have been ignored by many judges and politicians are too quick back the criminals
attributes.additional_details: To qualify for the death sentence the nominal must be over the age of 18 and for the that person to have proven beyond all reasonable doubt to have committed the offence of murder, rape or child molestation.   The sentence should be the same regardless of ethnic background or gender and should be law that applies to all people in our country.  The victims are so twice. Firstly, by the perpetrator and and again by the judicial system with the weak sentences they give.  This has to stop.

attributes.action: Legalize Cannabis Oil and use it in the NHS to help people suffering from Cancer
attributes.background: Cannabis Oil itself is able to cure Cancer and there is enough evidence and research to prove so. if this was legalized and put into the NHS,the amount of patients suffering from cancer would decrease and would effectively save people from Cancer.
attributes.additional_details:
also, the reason that cannabis oil (from cannabis) is not used to cure and kill cancer because it is a plant, and cannot be patented, which means pharmaceutical companies cannot make profit off it.

http://www.mirror.co.uk/news/world-news/government-finally-admits-cannabis-kills-6303176

https://www.cancertutor.com/index8/

http://www.cureyourowncancer.org/how-cannabis-oil-works.html

attributes.action: Make all technical sporting goods in the UK tax free to encourage participation
attributes.background: Cycling has increased in popularity immensely since the success of the 2012 Olympics and due to the Government's cycle to work scheme allowing tax free purchasing of cycle equipment. I would like to see all technical sporting goods to be tax free to encourage more people to take up sport in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: The Olympic success in 2012 and 2016 has shown that the UK has the ability to be a great sporting nation. We should encourage more sporting participation and a healthier lifestyle by allowing tax free purchases on all technical sporting goods and not just for those in full time employment. Clothing would be exempt but hardware would be tax free. E.G bicycles, helmets, running trainers, weight training equipment, trekking poles, climbing equipment etc anything which encourages sporting activity.

attributes.action: Put a stop to Annualised/Banked Hours contracts in workplaces.
attributes.background: The government needs to abolish the Banked/Annualised Hours contracts in workplaces. Employees are working over the working time directive, where the additional overtime is banked. This should be paid at a normal or premium rate as standard.
attributes.additional_details: Employees who work under this scheme have to constantly monitor hours that are either "Banked" or "Owed". Sometimes working unsociable hours, or days where the employer will then tactically either stand down employee from shift to ensure further hours are not "Banked", or put unreasonable requests to employees to make up hours "owed".

attributes.action:
Provide CCTV in all Care homes (
Special Needs, Disabled, Dementia, Elderly)
attributes.background: I am a single mum with a son who has autism and should he live in a care home, when i am no longer around, I want him to be protected and all his care to be recorded in case of negligence or abuse.

attributes.action: Call on the government to encourage Concorde to return to the skies.
attributes.background: Concorde was an amazing supersonic passenger aircraft which was in service between London, Paris, New York and Washington DC. Unfortunately it stopped its services in 2003, making an end to supersonic travel. It's ridiculous that today it takes 8 hours to go to New York when before it was only 3.

attributes.action: A database for compulsive gamblers to register to, banning further gambling
attributes.background: Gambling addictions are often underestimated in their control over individuals and the devastating impacts on the victim, family and friends. Effects of gambling unfortunately can include lost life savings, pensions, subsequent divorces and homelessness among many others.
attributes.additional_details: Gambling sites, advertisements, constant emails and the availability of gambling make it increasingly difficult for a compulsive gambler to resist the compulsion to gamble. Many people want to give up, the problem is the temptation, current protection offered by sites is not good enough. I propose a national data base where addicts can register to say they wish to be banned from all sites and casinos, it is then the responsibility of the sites or casinos to check this database to protect users

attributes.action: Protect consumers who experience emission problems with their diesel vehicles
attributes.background: Since 2009 diesel vehicles have been fitted with a diesel particulate filter (DPFs) to remove particles of soot etc from the exhaust to protect the environment and the air we breathe. These filters are failing or becoming clogged up and consumers are being presented with costly repair bills.
attributes.additional_details:
I personally was advised that to repair my Honda Civic which was under 4 years old and had covered 33000 miles the cost would be over Â£3600. Almost 20% of its cost new. Correspondence with Honda UK proved unsuccessful. Some manufacturers do not include DPF's in their warranties. 

I would like to see Manufacturers being forced to give 
1) A retrospective guarantee on DPF's for a period of 10 years or 150,000 miles
2) To recall all vehicles sold since 2009 and test the DPFs, compensating owners

attributes.action: Build HS2 up to an expanded Doncaster Sheffield Airport (DSA)
attributes.background: DSA is soon to be linked to the M18 a new dual carriageway, the A1 being one junction along the M18 and the M1 only three junctions away.  There is a "lot" of room available for an extra runway, new train station/terminal/parking. DSA has one of the longest runways in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently a train journey from London Kings Cross to London Heathrow takes 51 mins. The fastest train from Kings Cross to Doncaster is 95 mins using existing lines and railway stock, this could be vastly reduced if HS2 were to be built in this direction noting that DSA is also 6 miles South of Doncaster station, giving an extra reduction in transfer time.

Expansion can then be progressed in the North via HS3 and the proposed road route across the Pennines to Manchester.

attributes.action: Personally apologise to HM Forces personnel dismissed due to their sexuality.
attributes.background:
Thousands of serving gay military personnel suffered intrusive investigations into their sexuality, losing homes, careers and friends. Many faced homelessness, rejection and no suitable alternative career. Many experience unemployment and poor mental health, even now.
We demand a personal apology.
attributes.additional_details:
Not one individual subjected to investigation and dismissal from HM Forces, has ever received an apology. 
In 2007, the MOD provided a watery statement of recognition, but  many didn't know about it and it certainly wasn't personal. 
There is a moral obligation to apologise for this treatment. The effects of these investigations are still very real for these people.
Given the law in this area was only repealed in the 2016 revision of the Armed Forces Bill, the time is right to apologise.

attributes.action: UK should follow Donald Trump's policy and also put temporary travel ban
attributes.background: UK government should copy Donald Trump's policy and also impose a temporary travel ban on Syria, Lybia, Sudan, Yemen, Somalia, Iran and Iraq.

attributes.action: Back into society and work schemes for survivors of sexual and domestic abuse
attributes.background: lots of centres do not receive enough funding for survivors of sexual/domestic abuse, leaving the victim vulnerable and alone. Often secluded and struggling to live. There are schemes in place to help offenders of such crimes to get back into society and working but no such scheme for victims.
attributes.additional_details: In the last few years the U.K has seen massive cuts to helplines and therapy centres that provide great help to victims of abuse. A scheme was introduced that helps offenders of such abuse get back into society and start working again after their sentence or provides skills and training in prisons. Unfortunately no such scheme is in place to help victims get back into socialising, learning new skills, being able to work and sometimes even keep their homes. This needs to change.

attributes.action: Â£369 million proposed for Buckingham Palace to be used to fund Social Housing
attributes.background:
The Queen has been given a 66% payrise that will facilitate a Â£369 million refurbishment. 
Funnily enough the countless homeless on the Queen's own doorstep will not have enough points or be able to bid for any of the vacant rooms. Give this money to build social housing for the homeless.

attributes.action: Clearly define to Donald Trump what behaviour would end our special relationship
attributes.background: We the undersigned demand a debate in parliament to clearly define, both to the UK and US governments, what behaviour by the new US President-elect in office would result in the British people demanding the end of the UK-US special relationship.
attributes.additional_details: The UK-US special relationship has been built on shared values, objectives & defence over many years. We the undersigned want the special relationship to continue but it can only be special if those values, objectives & defence are still shared. Donald Trump has been democratically elected president of the US, having made remarks during his campaign that many in the UK do not agree with. It is not our place to interfere with who is US president, but we can decide how we respond to the choice.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to produce and use products made of non-recyclable plastic
attributes.background: We need to stop thinking that plastic waste is being dealt with to the degree at which it is advertised. We do not need non-recyclable plastic, and this is evident by the amount we only use once - then throw away every day.
attributes.additional_details: A large amount of plastics marked 'recyclable' are not recycled in the UK (mostly mixed plastics) and are instead sent abroad to be disposed of. As a result of this, we need to open far more facilities capable of processing and recycling mixed plastics. Our use of non-recyclable plastic is unsustainable, irresponsible and unnecessary.

attributes.action: Make the sale of non-approved spring traps illegal.
attributes.background:
At present it is only illegal to USE non-approved traps. 
The law should be extended to ban the SALE of any trap not approved under the Spring Traps Approval Order 2012.
attributes.additional_details:
The present loop-hole allows sellers to sell inferior imported traps that have not been type-approved by DEFRA. This causes unnecessary suffering as these inferior traps often maim rather than give an instant kill. 

These imports are undemining the businesses in the UK that manufacture the genuine approved products.

attributes.action: Introduce LGBT relationship education, similar to heterosexual relationships.
attributes.background: If we introduce LGBT education from a young age, we are more likely to rid the country of the stigma that still affects young people, and causes bullying and harm throughout our society. Educating people will almost definitely reduce the ignorance that causes homophobia.

attributes.action: Do not allow the sale of our utilities to foreign companies
attributes.background: A Chinese consortium are trying to purchase a majority stake in National Grid's Â£11billion gas distribution network. The Prime Minister promised tighter regulations on foreign investments in the UK, it seems to be an empty promise. Our utilities need to stay under British control. Sign if you agree.

attributes.action: Give English voters a say in the event of a 2nd Scottish Independence referendum
attributes.background: Nicola Sturgeon is calling for a new Referendum on Scottish Independence. In the event such a referendum is granted, we demand that a vote is given to all English voters to give us a choice on whether or not we want to keep Scotland, and move our military contracts South of the Border to England!
attributes.additional_details: http://www.msn.com/en-gb/news/uknews/nicola-sturgeon-launches-second-scottish-independence-referendum-drive-after-brexit-vote/ar-AAioSmM?li=BBoPWjQ

attributes.action: Bring back public information films showing the dangers HGV drivers face
attributes.background: HGV drivers are constantly put in danger due to the way that other road users behave toward us when a car joins a motorway or pulls out into the line of on coming HGVs and explaining safe distances
attributes.additional_details: Increasing dash cam footage found on most online forums within the industry

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for all schools to have carbohydrate content lists
attributes.background:
Diabetic children all over the Uk miss hot school meals as there's no legal requirement for school to have carb  contents for their meals. 
As a diabetic child, Riley (7) has to injection insulin every time he eats, the amount depends on the carbs he is about to eat. Without this info he cannot eat
attributes.additional_details:
As a type1 diabetic you must inject inject insulin with all food and drink for life, there is no cure, there is also no cause so it's unpreventable!
The amount you inject depends on the amount of carbohydrate you are about to eat.
At the minute there is no legal requirement for schools to have this information meaning children are missing out on a hot school meal.
I believe all schools in the uk should have a list of carbohydrate contents for each meal so our children can eat a healthy hot meal

attributes.action: Inculde more safety elements in the driving test towards motorcycle awareness
attributes.background: too often cars drift around their lanes freely instead of staying straight, especially when moving slowly, this makes filtering through traffic Dangerous! Car drivers pay very little attention to motorcyclist. While I was learning to drive a car, not one thing was ever mentioned about a motorbike!
attributes.additional_details:
I personally have been hit by 2 cars within 2 years and neither of them were my fault, this could be easily avoided if people where taught about motorcyclists while learning to drive! I have witnessed more times than I care to count, cars use their full acceleration in traffic to move from a slow moving lane to a faster moving lane without thought of a motorcycle. They do this as they are not taught about about motorcyclist! This WILL save lives.

Thanks you for reading and please sign & share
